page.title: 16TOURISM IN CLAYBROOKE PARVA
page.content: A TOURIST GUIDE TO CLAYBROOKE PARVA On entering CLaybrooke Parva from Lutterworth, over the bridge you will pass 1 Ave. Villas which used to be a small private school. Claybrooke House where Suffolk Punch Horses are bred. The white cottage ajoining the Homestead was the site of the old blacksmiths. St Peter's Church with Norman tower Claybrooke Hall built 1710 with underground passage to church. Hidden by a hedge the once moated rectory. Claybrooke Primary School built in 1813 by the Marc Smith Charity Trust. The Old School House, home of Mary Herbert who was, until last year, the school caretaker for 31 years .
